intro: Cephaelis tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, oval-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Cephaelis tetragona is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
